question: What is a branch in Git?

choices.text: A copy of your repository stored on a remote server
A lightweight movable pointer to a specific commit
A backup file created automatically by Git
A folder where deleted files are stored

question: What is the default branch name in most Git repositories?
Which command shows all branches in your repository?
Creating a new branch creates a complete copy of all your project files.
What is the purpose of using branches?

choices.text: To work on features or fixes in isolation without affecting the main codebase
